subject: Add resize partition service for root file system.
commitMessage:
Add resize partition service for root file system.

When booting the device at first time, the root partition should be
extended by using resize2fs command.

Change-Id: Ia16fd837a6c78b3d3b49e1d9bf20a7c9afef6c63
Signed-off-by: Sangjung Woo <sangjung.woo@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

I fixed the thing that Maciej commented. Thanks.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 2:

I have missed the review, hence I should not complain now. On the other hand I investigated resizing a lot and I can tell that doing it this way is bad. The biggest problem is remounting the root filesystem rw/ro. If

* the root filesystem is going to be ro (not in Tizen 3.0) and,
* something else starts when the root filesystem is being mounted rw and,
* it opens a file on the root filesysetm for writing (which most probably is going to be because of a bug but a very hard to find bug),

then it won't be possible to remmount root read-only. The only robust way to resize the root filesystem if it is ro is to do it from initrd/initramfs.

subject: Synchronize package with tizen 3.0
commitMessage:
Synchronize package with tizen 3.0

Some features provided by system-plugin-mount are redundant. In particular:
- /lib/modules is provided by filesystem package
- /etc/fstab file is generated on image creation (setup-mobile package)
- /etc/inittab and /etc/rc.d/* files are not used anymore
- resizing filesystems on boot is going to be reworked

Change-Id: Ia60f6151d3fbb2bf2e3b2e4f75be0e4ce22e420a
Signed-off-by: Jacek Bukarewicz <j.bukarewicz@samsung.com>

comments.message: Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
